sentences.en: "'Imperious Caesar , dead and turned to clay,'' said Melanie with a sad smile.
sentences.cn: " '不可一世的凯撒大帝,也人亡物故,变成了泥土'呢, "媚兰面带苦笑说.

sentences.en: A person , who is imperious and tries to gloss over his fault, is bound to suffer in the end.
sentences.cn: 专横跋扈、文过饰非的人到头来总是要吃亏的.

sentences.en: All his imperious orders were obeyed.
sentences.cn: 他所有那些专横的命令都被服从了.

sentences.en: From across the desk she gave him a witheringly imperious look.
sentences.cn: 她从桌子对面扫了他一眼，目光咄咄逼人，凌利而专横。

sentences.en: He was aggressive and imperious; positive in his convictions.
sentences.cn: 他很进取,但又很傲慢; 坚持自己的信念.

sentences.en: He was certainly much more imperious - she ended by calling it imperial.
sentences.cn: 他肯定更加盛气凌人,不,更加气宇轩昂.

sentences.en: Her attitude is imperious at times.
Her mother surveyed her admiringly, conscious of her imperious mood.
sentences.cn: 她的母亲觉出了她那傲慢的情调,赞赏地观察着她.

sentences.en: She raised her hand in an imperious gesture.
She sent them away with an imperious wave of the hand.
sentences.cn: 她轻蔑高傲的挥手示意他们离开.

sentences.en: She was strict, imperious 14 , and did not accept laziness or incompetence 15 in her dancers.
sentences.cn: 她严格 、 甚至苛刻,从不姑息迁就舞蹈学员的懒惰和不合格.

sentences.en: The old nun was as imperious as ever , but visibly thawed when she saw the children.
sentences.cn: 老修女仍然像从前一样专橫,看到孩子们时却显得温和多了.

sentences.en: The placid sunshine transformed in a moment into imperious angry fire.
sentences.cn: 和煦的阳光瞬间变成了咄咄逼人的烈焰.

sentences.en: The slum now began to stir into life , and the factory hooter sounded its imperious summons.
sentences.cn: 草棚区域人声动了.裕华厂里的汽笛威武地嘟嘟地叫.

sentences.en: They are rather imperious to their good Moon and her divine sons.
sentences.cn: 他们对月亮女神和她的神圣的儿子们,未免有些太卤莽了.

sentences.en: Yet he was imperious sometimes still: but I did not mind that.
sentences.cn: 可是,他有时候还是专横,不过我并不介意.

trans.tran_en: giving orders and expecting to be obeyed, in a way that seems too proud
